name: overmedicated
text: Hell, I thought I'd gone through all the strips and used them up, but there's this little pocket I've missed. They're so good... like the chips in the bottom of the bag.

name: nsrdude
text: I been reading this since day 1 and I sometime still find the odd one or two I missed because of some daft reason.

name: ted0phile
text: The avatar match-up here is not a little unsettling.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: seconded.

name: overmedicated
text: Sorry to ruin it with my bananas guys.

name: snowman
text: Is that what those are...

name: ganymedeio
text: ted0phile:  Master of avatar awareness.

name: epicurus
text:
I love how he would not like to release that statement for use in their official literature.

Also it is so amazing how he shakes a little when the guy asks him to actually say the synonyms for sad.

name: nicolae
text: you can actually see the indignation exuding from him

name: epicurus
text: I'd also like to point out that rather than going with "unhappy" or "depressed", Cornelius picked two of the most badass synonyms for "sad" possible.

name: connormc
text: Cornelius is some hell of a candy-ass word-style hero.

name: connormc
text:
Oh god damn if that wasn't pat that ramses said that to

I am disconsolate and I apologize

name: william
text: I just feel bad that Cornelious Bear has to keep selling out like this.  Remember how he was writing subtitles for the Spice Channel?  The man won the fucking Badass Games, he deserves so much more.

name: unfun
text: In a way, though, nothing is more badass than shamelessly hustling.

name: wozzeck
text:
Are you ever entirely honest about yourself, unfun?

Place a shameless huckster in a room with a stout man of deeds, and rest assured you will learn what is what!

name: mangtastic
text: I can't not imagine this being spoken in a Klaus Kinski voice.

name: invidious
text: Dude, Cornelius is so badass he's getting people to PAY to listen to him talk about DIRT.  That's not just raw, that's raw fugu.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Hey, wise up. Wouldn't we all like to be paid by the Smart Club just for being smart?

name: agika
text: Mensa pays Cornelius Bear to participate in a lecture circuit?  How the hell did any of the other guys think they stood a chance against Cornelius in the Badass Games?  What were they thinking?

name: boredom_man
text: Because they have badder asses than Lisa Simpson and Comic Book Guy?

name: zeal
text: I dunno, man.  Comic Book Guy's ass is pretty bad.  Horrible, even.

name: tekende
text: BOO TO THAT

name: goatmasterflash
text: Comic Book Guy's ass is so horrible, he requires prescription pants.

name: dans
text:
Cripes, do I hate Mensa.
Their ads alone are pretentious.

name: omegatron
text: There are others who are disappointed with what Mensa has and has not become. At a 1996 convention celebrating the 50th anniversary of Mensa's founding, Dr. Ware (now 81 years old) voiced hope "that Mensa will have a role in society when it gets through the ages of infancy and adolescence ... but at least it has satisfied its members." Dr. Ware seemed disheartened by the Mensans' seeming inability to focus beyond self-gratifying pursuits and apply their collective brain-power to problems facing the world today. "I do get disappointed that so many members spend so much time solving puzzles," Ware said. "It's a form of mental masturbation. Nothing comes of it."

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
"It's a form of mental masturbation. Nothing comes of it."
What a huge and worthy pun on satisfied its members
If Mensans did not get that, they should be drummed out Immediately!

name: chaesar
text: True, but Dali's "Lugubrious Game" is one wicked example of his obsessions.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Raymond Smuckles, "PhDtm"

name: bookofsand
text: I want to give it a 5, but the image of Ray in panel three coulda been more... ironic, maybe. Like so.

name: gompo
text: You're too used to seeing him.  Try seeing him like someone who has never read Achewood would see him:  An upright cat, with glasses and a giant medallion around his neck, wearing a thong and nothing else.

name: terribleman
text: When I describe Ray (in pretty much those words) to people outside the Achewood community, they get a kind of scared look on their faces, and I can tell they are not coming to grips with what they hear.

name: anzio
text: Yeah, anyone I know who knows only a little bit about Achewood but not much else refer to the comic as, "That webcomic with the cat in the thong."

name: steerpike66
text:
I like that Cornelius quivers very slightly with indignation and then discreetly turns his back before saying his synonyms.

Morose. Downcast. Joyless.

name: cdl146
text: Poor Cornelius, he tries so hard to be a man of principle, but always has to sell out to the man.

name: jackparsons
text: Onstad lives in Palo Alto, as did I. He's letting them off soooooo easy.

name: henrythecad
text: I'd release that quote for use in their official literature. I have lots of other ones too.

name: noah_j
text: i cannot for the life of me tell who is being played here.

name: falseprophet
text: A comment left by falseprophet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, kenthegod, Scorpio_nadir, scraggg)

name: heccibiggs
text:
I think you got three lames for joking about Lincoln's assassination.

Too soon.

name: fermatprime
text: That's Cornelius. I know him.

name: fermatprime
text: I know Cornelius.

name: luckypyjamas
text: five for the alt text, i am thinking

name: negative_creep
text: I know it's kinda part of the joke, but I can't help feeling there's this huge misunderstanding about Mensa being propagated, here... So just as a sidenote, Mensa is about cognitive abilities, not trivia. You could qualify for Mensa even if you never read a book in your life; The only education you need is being able to count.

name: dumase
text: Soil. The next word is soil.

name: eca
text: ...sand. SAND. SAND. ...soil. SOIL. SOIL.

name: charchar
text:
[poetry]E. E. Cummings[/philosophy]

O sweet spontaneous
earth how often have
the
doting

fingers of
purient philosophers pinched
and
poked

thee
,has the naughty thumb
of science prodded
thy

beauty .how
oftn have religions taken
thee upon their scraggy knees
squeezing and

buffeting thee that thou mightest conceive
gods
(but
true

to the incomparable
couch of death thy
rhythmic
lover

thou answerest


them only with


spring)

name: charchar
text: Hm, [url=http://www.cs.rice.edu/~ssiyer/minstrels/poems/945.html]it seems one can't trust assetbar with spatial poetry.  Oh, well,[/u]

name: charchar
text:
My composure slips a bit

Grrr. Coooooon!!!

name: mattylite
text: Huh, to someone with only a passing knowledge of either, ee cummings poems look an awful lot like javascript.

name: boredom_man
text: If you code it into your web page Digital Barbara Hershey will have sex with you.

name: mattylite
text: [img]http://i34.tinypic.com/2coh2sp.png[/i]

name: mattylite
text:
I mean:

name: aamzed
text: I want that Ray scene on a t-shirt.

name: vermy
text:
Mensa, for all their pretense, are actually men of low minds.
I think that is the message of this strip

name: adult_beverages
text: "PhD"

name: duperando
text: I like how later in the comic Cornelius gets alot more mellow and less "old man"ish. He scolds less, and instead he's a straight-up casanova.

name: rakadin
text: I was a Mensa member for a little over a year.  Went to all of one of their get-togethers.  Let my membership lapse when I realized I was paying $57 annually to be told I was smart.  I am now richer in dollars, if poorer in ego.  I am pleased with this trade-off.

name: homepie
text: I honestly don't think Ray is actually smart enough to me a member of MENSA. He seems more like the kinda guy who would get an IQ quiz completely right by just guessing.
